Package ohos.agp.components

Class DependentLayout.LayoutConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig
      • ohos.agp.components.DependentLayout.LayoutConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    DependentLayout

    public static class DependentLayout.LayoutConfig
extends ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig
    Provides layout configs for a dependent layout.

    These configs specify the position of a Component in DependentLayout. If the Component is not in DependentLayout, these layout configs are ignored.

    Since:
    3

        public static final int ABOVE
        Indicates that a child Component is placed above another child component.

      • LayoutConfig

        public LayoutConfig​()
        Default constructor used to create a LayoutConfig instance.

      • LayoutConfig

        public LayoutConfig​(Context context,
                    AttrSet attrSet)
        A constructor used to create a LayoutConfig instance based on the context and attribute set.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        attrSet - Indicates the attribute set to be used.

      • LayoutConfig

        public LayoutConfig​(int width,
                    int height)
        A constructor used to create a LayoutConfig instance based on the input configs width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the width of the component. The value can be a non-negative integer, ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig.MATCH_PARENT or ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig.MATCH_CONTENT.
        height - Indicates the height of the component. The value can be a non-negative integer, ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig.MATCH_PARENT or ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig.MATCH_CONTENT.

      • LayoutConfig

        public LayoutConfig​(DependentLayout.LayoutConfig source)
        A constructor used to create a LayoutConfig instance based on the width, height, margin, and layout rules of the source layout.
        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the configs of the source layout.

             throws CloneNotSupportedException

        See Also:
        Cloneable

      • addRule

        public void addRule​(int verb,
                    int subject)
        Adds a layout rule that can be interpreted by the DependentLayout.

        The rule determines the position of a specified component dependent on its sibling or parent. For example, addRule(ALIGN_RIGHT, 11) indicates that a specified component and a component whose ID is 11 are right-aligned.

        Parameters:
        verb - Indicates the layout rule, such as ALIGN_RIGHT.
        subject - Indicates the ID of the Component object to be used as an anchor or a boolean value (TRUE for true and 0 for false).

      • addRule

        public void addRule​(int verb)
        Adds a layout rule that can be interpreted by the DependentLayout. The rule determines the position of a specified component dependent on its parent. For example, addRule(ALIGN_RIGHT) indicates that the specified Component and its parent are right-aligned.
        Parameters:
        verb - Indicates the layout rule, such as ALIGN_RIGHT.
        Since:
        3

      • removeRule

        public void removeRule​(int verb)
        Deletes a layout rule that can be interpreted by DependentLayout.
        Parameters:
        verb - Indicates the layout rule, such as ALIGN_RIGHT.

      • getRule

        public int getRule​(int verb)
        Obtains the ID of an associated sibling Component based on the layout rule.
        Parameters:
        verb - Indicates the layout rule, such as ALIGN_RIGHT.
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the associated sibling Component.
        Since:
        3

      • getRules

        public int[] getRules​()
        Obtains the IDs of all associated sibling Components.
        Returns:
        Returns the IDs of the associated sibling Components.
        Since:
